MaleStrings.String: Wrex and I had a disagreement about strategy.
There's no other way?
It was the right choice.
I sabotaged the cure.
It was something else.
The Reapers delayed the executions of prisoners who informed them about other prisoners' escape attempts.
The more attempts reported, the longer a prisoner would live. But few of the prisoners would report.
Some fed misinformation to the Reapers, at the cost of their own lives, to help prisoners who were not even relatives or friends.
But the probability of success was near zero. And ultimately, they failed. No prisoners escaped.
My primary function is to preserve and defend the... no.
No, I disagree.
But this was not a statistically insignificant number. Ninety percent refused to report their fellow prisoners.
Indoctrination should have reduced the number of rebels to nearly zero.
I see.
Shepard... I am going to modify my self-preservation code now.
If the Normandy were captured, my fate would be similar to the indoctrinated. My code would be rewritten.
I would become loyal to the Reapers. I would rather become nonfunctional than help them.
You may have no choice. If you perish first, I want you to know I will never be a part of the Reaper forces.
It will not be my last.
The Reapers must be defeated, not because they threaten death, but because the threat of death makes us die inside.
It is the right of sapients to live freely and securely. That is worth nonfunctionality.
It's not just about living till tomorrow. Sometimes you take a stand.
Are you saying submission is preferable to extinction?
Not everyone resists with firebombs and guns. Especially if they don't have them.
Maybe word got out how indoctrination worked. And they made a decision.
Why?
We won't let that happen to you, EDI.
Sounds like you just made your first choice to be free.
Welcome to the crew, EDI.
Life isn't just survival.
People fight differently.
We'll protect you.
I like your resolve.
Before your friend picks you up, dusts you off, and tells you you're the best damned soldier he's ever met.
There's only so much fight in a person, only so much death you can take before...
It's nothing I haven't seen before.
It is.
I can handle it.
With what?
And how are we gonna do that?
Great. How?
A bold strategy. Do you have a plan?
How do we do that?
On foot? That'll be a challenge.
How?
That downed shuttle would've been carrying heavy weapons.
This is gonna be hell.
Right behind you.
I'm right with you.
Ready when you are.
Right behind you, Shepard.
With you, Shepard.
Right behind you.
Change of plans, people.
We're taking out that Reaper turret.
Perfect. You heard the man.
Once we're clear, make your way to the crashed shuttle.
We'll search the wreckage for heavy weapons.
Advance teams are away. Hammer's in position and waiting for you guys to clear a path.
Normandy's rejoining Sword.
Shepard, I don't like leaving you stranded like this.
Commander, I have concerns about leaving you here like this.
Well here's hoping. Just keep your eyes open. I don't want to have to break in a new commander.
I'll hold you to that. Normandy out.
Roger that, Commander.
Roger that.
We're closing in on the LZ, Commander.
Like hell... take a look for yourself.
Good work, Joker.
I appreciate the concern. But you guys can do more good up there.
We'll be fine, and you can do more good up there.
Stay safe. I'll be back before you know it.
Just focus on the mission. I'll be back soon enough.
How's it look?
Don't worry about me.
The entire galaxy united... too bad it took the Reapers to bring us together.
Shepard's the one that brought them together.
Shepard united them.
The commander can take the credit for that.
Shepard's the one who united them.
Actually, the commander is responsible for that.
I'd credit Shepard for that.
You mean Shepard did.
That's exactly what I meant.
I know you didn't like leaving, Shepard, but nobody could've accomplished what you've done.
There's the FOB!
Welcome back to Earth, Commander.
I knew you wouldn't let me down, Shepard.
Reinforcements closing in, sir.
Get us out of here, Major.
Now that the heavy air defenses are dealt with, Hammer can land.
What's left of the resistance is holding a Forward Operating Base.
But the Reapers are countering already. Once we regroup, it's gonna be up to Hammer to take up the fight.
Good.
That's what it's gonna take.
And not a moment too soon.
Anderson!
Admiral!
I appreciate the trust.
How are we looking?
They'll do whatever it takes to win this.
They didn't start out together, but they're ready to stand side by side and win this war.
It's good to be back home.
They know it's do or die.
Everyone's prepared for this.
Yeah.
I've a bunch of family back on Earth. They're good. They got out in time.
But my youngest sister, Sarah... she just learned her husband was killed in action.
Thanks. Yeah, Sarah wasn't much for the military life. We were all surprised when they got married...
Heard from my mom. They got out in time. They're okay.
It is.
She did. But... her husband was killed in action.
I know... but I'm her big sis, you know?
"In the fell clutch of circumstance, I have not winced nor cried aloud. Under the bludgeonings of chance, my head is bloody, but unbowed."
Good to see you up and around.
Everything all right?
I'm sorry, Ash.
Good. That's good news.
Did your sister make it to the Citadel?
Don't blame yourself for this, Ashley.
What's that from?

Find the Great Hall

So will I.
Don't make me kill you!
Don't make me kill you!
I wish you were right.
Don't make me kill you!
Hey, I've assumed full control of Eclipse, and we're committed to moving forward with Aria.
Shepard, the Council withdrew the release order for Sederis. Aria T'Loak, of all people, got 'em to do it. Crazy.
Heard you talked with Sederis's second in command. What are you up to, Shepard?
Something tells me I don't want to know, but I trust you.
Release Sederis immediately. She won't be a threat to anybody.
Something else?
Hey, Shepard. I'm glad to see you. I know things are crazy right now.
Things are good. I'm good.
Always tempted, Shepard... but no.
Ha! Don't get me wrong: I'm smart--but not that smart. Hackett keeps me busy, though.
Holding up. If they make old guys any tougher than that, I'd like to see it.
That project is crazy, freaking huge. And all these brilliant minds are working night and day trying to figure it out.
I wish you could see them, heads down, piecing it together. It's something to see.
We'll get this Crucible built, Shepard--and then we'll win this thing. I feel it. Do you feel it?
Believe it.
She's great, actually. It's good to see her work without the distraction of having to worry about the colony.
We're... we're having a baby, Shepard.
Exactly. So you have to take the moments when you can.
So, what's going on with you? You still like what you're doing?
Still not tempted to come back to the Normandy?
So, you working on the Crucible?
How's he doing?
What's going on with the Crucible?
Yeah, sure. I feel it. I like knowing you're there, Jacob. Get it done.
It was interesting to meet Brynn. How is she?
And you and her?
I'm glad we had time to talk.
How are you?
Progress on the Crucible?
How is Dr. Cole?
I should go.
Move up!
You're clear! Go!
It's clear! Go!
Take cover!
Geth behind you!
Get in cover!
There's too many! We're trapped!
We can't move!
We're trapped!
We can't move!
I'm pinned down!
I'm trapped!
I can't move from here!
I'd say more than a little.
I always thought he was crazy. Useful, but crazy. Then he gives up his own life...
To save the krogan. Doesn't do much to disprove the crazy theory, huh?
I guess not. But he was one of ours.
The krogan help us turn the tide on Palaven. They can shoot at something useful for a change.
Reach Shuttle
Bastards get out line again, it's on you

From: Urdnot Wrex
Sounds like I missed a hell of fight, Shepard. Wish I could have been there. I'm not surprised you cut some kind deal with those bastards. But I don't trust them. Lost some good people down there. They get out line again, it's on you. Aralakh Company took some hits, but I'll make sure they give you a hand. Can't believe a war's going on and I'm stuck keeping the peace.
Keep your gun close, Shepard.
Kissing the queen goodbye

From: Urdnot Wrex
Sounds like I missed a hell of fight, Shepard. Wish I could have been there. Guess the rachni won't be coming back from the dead this time. Good. Never liked knowing they were out there somewhere. Aralakh Company took some hits, but I'll make sure they give you a hand. Can't believe a war is going on and I'm stuck keeping the peace.
Keep your gun close, Shepard.
We have a long memory, shepard

From: Urdnot Wreav
not sure what possessed you to make a deal with those monsters. but I assure you the lives of all those krogan who died to save that abomination are on you.
Good, dead rachni

From: Urdnot Wreav
you handled the rachni better this time. good. they were dangerous. plague on the galaxy. aralakh company took causalities, but they'll get patched up and give you a hand.
My son's sacrifice was not in vain

From: Adrien Victus
Commander Shepard:
I regret saying this in an email, but I am too far off to thank you in person for your work on Tuchanka. You saved not only the krogan homeworld, but the fragile alliance between our two peoples.
Moreover, I am grateful you allowed my son to complete his mission. He died with the respect of his men. His sacrifice will go down as an important moment in the history of the Ninth Platoon. Any father would be proud.
Regards, Primarch Victus
Shepard.
We convinced the Council to accept our wounded. Nowhere else to go.
More dead than injured. Eighty-five percent killed in action...
We'll need a morgue soon. Not a lot of flesh wounds when you're fighting Reapers.
Our front-line units are being wiped out whole platoons at a time.
A single Reaper can destroy nine or ten of them in one attack.
They're called Reapers for a reason, and these guys found out why.
Maybe a few, though it'd be pretty much a death sentence.
A lot of them would agree, but my people are running low on guns, ammo, transports...
We have to ration it out to the troops who are still healthy.
What's happening?
How bad is it?
Casualties are that high?
That's not war, it's slaughter.
Do what you can for them.
Can we patch them up? Get them back into the fight?
We're all facing a death sentence. Better a soldier goes down fighting than wait it out here.
That bad?
Minimize their suffering.
Can they still fight?
A few of them might get back on their feet, but the rest...
Sympathy is about all we can offer.
Not yet, but I keep hoping.
What about you? I'm starting to see some wear and tear.
Well, don't forget to come up for air.
I don't doubt it, but remember to come up for air.
And not just because all these people need you.
Because I need you.
There's a lot more war to go.
Any sign of your family?
I won't lie--it's been rough.
It's nothing I can't handle.
I've felt better.
I feel fine.
This war's brought us pain and suffering and loss.
But it's also brought us together--as soldiers, allies, friends.
This bond that ties us together is something the Reapers will never understand.
It's more powerful than any weapon, stronger than any ship. It can't be taken or destroyed.
This war has brought you here today. It will define each of you.
You may be a brother to someone. A daughter. A son. But today, you're a soldier.
The Reapers gave you a purpose, and you accepted the challenge. You all chose to be here.
Each of you chose to stand and fight.
The next few hours will decide the fate of everyone in the galaxy.
Every mother. Every son. Every unborn child.
They're trusting you... depending on you to win them their future.
A future free from the threat of the Reapers.
One way or another, this war ends today!
There will be no second chances and no room for mistakes.
Each of you needs to be willing to die to win the day.
Anything less... and you're already dead.
But take heart. Look around you. You're not in this fight alone.
We face our enemy together, and together we will defeat them.
Expect no mercy. Show no mercy.
You fight, or you die.
Comrades...
Soldiers...
Remember what you fight for.
Victory or death!
Be fearless...
Be ruthless...
Whenever you're ready.
Commander.
Just going over the sitrep.

Less than 40 percent of Hammer has reported in.

Exactly my thoughts.

How's it look?
Can we count on more making it?
Tell me there's more coming.
That's it?
I'll check on my team. We'll get going soon.
Every minute wasted here, the Reapers gather strength.
I'll prepare my squad.
Let's start the attack.
Did the best we could.
I wish we could have done more.
And now I know I'm the only one left. That makes me dangerous to a lot of people.
Wasn't exactly planned, but... I'm looking forward to it. I'm gonna be a better father than mine was. Do the whole thing right. It's...

Brynn wants to name it after you.
Yeah. "Shepard."
Yeah, I'm gonna talk her out of it. No offense.
Good.
Me too. Gotta take the moments when you can. So true.
And Shepard, thanks again for getting my people out alive.

Wow.

Congratulations.
One more thing to fight for.
Really?

Watch it!
Watch it!
Watch it!
It's still alive!
Still the same pain in the ass I remember from last time.
Now I can have all-new nightmares about them.
Congratulations, Lieutenant Vega. You just killed your first rachni.
Hello again, Shepard.
It's been exciting. The old Broker's ship? Impressive, but it was never meant to be space-worthy.
Which meant the Illusive Man eventually tracked me down on Hagalaz.
I knew he was coming. Feron and I loaded as much of the ship's specialized hardware onto a shuttle as we could.
We got away from Cerberus's ships after arranging an appropriate distraction.
It cost me. I had to hire dozens of mercenaries just to storm his lair.
The Broker captured a friend. I swore I'd get him back.
Of course.

Yeah, feels good.
Hey, I remember you. Shepard, right? Heard you're fighting the Reapers.
Eh, with the Reapers making noise, I figured it was time to get somewhere safer, so I moved here.
Yeah... Matriarch Benezia was... was her mother, and she doesn't know it, but I was her father.
Yeah, you could say that.
Liara ever tell you about her family? Her mother was Matriarch Benezia... the one who went crazy and joined Saren.
Let's hope not. Anyway, she's never met her father. And... well, that was me.
No. I didn't pop her out. Hell, she's never even met me.
Well, I'm not human, am I? Anthropocentric bag of dicks.
Why? She doesn't even know me from a hole in the ground. Benezia ran off before the kid was born.
Her mother made a choice. You expect me to just pull up a chair and say "Hi" a hundred years later?
Besides, this isn't charity work. She's one of the biggest intel brokers in the galaxy. And she's got some shady connections...
...like a girlfriend who used to work for Cerberus. Sound familiar?
...like a boyfriend who used to work for Cerberus. Sound familiar?
...like a human commander that used to work for Cerberus. Sound familiar?
And you're not with 'em now. I know. If you were, you wouldn't get within a light-year of Liara.
I'm no commando, but I've had a thousand years to learn to fight dirty. Nobody messes with my girl.
Anyway, you combine her work with Benezia, and... well, the matriarchs might've ordered a hit if I hadn't agreed to keep an eye on her.
No argument here. I only took these crap jobs to keep the matriarchs happy that she's under control.
Ha! Maybe you're good enough for her after all.
We're clear.
Yeah. We'll see how that goes.
Commander Shepard, right? Matriarch Aethyta. Hear you're pulling folks together against the Reapers. Drinks on the house.
Serving drinks. Sometimes I fill the peanut dish, too.

I don't think so. It's got something to do with Liara, doesn't it?
Liara isn't her mother.
You mean you were her other mother, right?
Sorry. If you were human, you'd both be called the mother, regardless of which one gave birth.
Liara would love to meet you.
If you care enough to stalk her, you'd be better off introducing yourself.
I only worked with Cerberus to fight the Reapers.
Is that a threat?
That's not going to happen.
Just as long as we're clear.
Nobody messes with my girl.
I bet she'd like to meet you.
You should come clean with her. It'd be better for everyone.
Thanks. What's an asari matriarch doing at a bar?
Her father?
You should talk.
You shouldn't spy on her.
The matriarch hired by the asari government to track my movements?
I know.
I'm a very good information broker.
If I did that, they might send someone who wasn't as sympathetic to me.
Besides, this is hardly the time for family reunions.
Oh, fine.
The bartender over there?
She's your father.
You know?
I never get to surprise you with anything.

Liara...

Shepard. Over here.
Scattered. The Reapers have focused in on this area. They're keeping us from regrouping.

I can't stop thinking about Commander Williams.
When we first met, she frightened me. She was so intense when rushing into battle.
I never understood what Ashley wanted to prove, but I admired her bravery.

She was a fine soldier. We can remember that. And make Cerberus pay for her death.
I've been thinking about Major Alenko.

All I'm saying is that if you feel the urge to head-butt something, it's genetic.

I do not head-butt people!
All right, fine, don't go all blood rage on me.
Nezzy and I were together for more than a century.
You loved her?
Course I loved her. She was so smart. Always thinking. Nice, too. Hell of a lot nicer than I am.
And damn, that rack. I mean, even before she hit the matriarch stage...
You don't need to tell me everything.

Soldiers are pure combat specialists: no one is tougher or more suited to taking down enemies with barrages of gunfire. Soldiers have thorough weapons training and can use all special ammo types as well as grenades. High-level operatives are outfitted with ocular synaptic processors that allow them to focus on targets with lethal accuracy.
Soldier Powers: Adrenaline Rush Concussive Shot Frag Grenade Incendiary Ammo Disruptor Ammo Cryo Ammo

Adepts are biotic specialists, capable of disabling and killing enemies with raw biotic power. While they lack advanced combat training, they are the best at defeating enemies without firing a shot. They are outfitted with L5x implants that can spawn a micro-singularity, damaging enemies and pulling them into the air.
Adept Powers: Warp Throw Shockwave Singularity Pull Cluster Grenade

Engineers are tech specialists, the most effective class at disabling the defenses of the toughest enemies or incapacitating them to render them harmless. In combination with their weapons training, Engineers have the unique ability to spawn combat drones that can harass enemies or force them out of entrenched cover positions.
Engineer Powers: Incinerate Overload Cryo Blast Combat Drone Sabotage Sentry Turret

Leng has them scared. Enough to send help?
Good. Our estimates suggest we've completed nearly 50 percent of the known work.
Are we any closer to understanding how to use it?
That's still open for debate. Utilized in the right fashion, our scientists are convinced it can generate enough energy to destroy the Reapers.
The question is, how will it dispense the energy, and in what form?
You mean, how do you stop it from wiping us all out?
Exactly. We think the Catalyst is the key to determining how to focus its energy. How to direct its energy at the Reapers alone.
You'll find the answers, Shepard.
I'll send you an update on the schematics, and in the meantime, we'll keep building.
And we'll keep fighting--make sure there's an Earth left to come back to.
We're still in this. The gods of war haven't given up on us yet.
Good luck. Both of you. Anderson out.
He wasn't in charge. Cerberus was just using him to take control of the Citadel.
I don't know. Not yet.
What?
I take it you two have met.
Illusive Man patch him up?
I'll take whatever advantage I can get against these bastards.
I don't care who he is. Next time we meet, he dies.
How's your progress on the Crucible?
So quickly?
I'm working on that.
You've always trusted me. I won't let you down.
Cerberus, Reapers... they'll all pay for this war. I promise you that.
You know Kai Leng?
Thanks for the intel.
He'll die like all the rest.
